blurb: R is an interpreted, open source programming language with powerful data manipulation and graphical capabilities. It has a thriving package ecosystem and is one of the most popular languages for data science.

concepts.name: Basics
concepts.blurb: TODO: add blurb for basics concept

key_features.title: Domain Specific
key_features.content: R is a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics.

key_features.title: Cross-platform
key_features.content: It is free, open source, and available on every major platform.

key_features.title: Multi-paradigm
key_features.content: R has a strong foundation of functional programming, but is inherently multi-paradigm, facilitating procedural or object-oriented approaches when suitable.

key_features.title: Metaprogramming
key_features.content: Râ€™s metaprogramming capabilities allow for magically succinct and concise functions.

key_features.title: Tooling
key_features.content: R provides powerful tools for data science with a massive set of packages for data manipulation, statistical modelling, visualisation and machine learning.

key_features.title: Community
key_features.content: R has a diverse and welcoming community.
